definition: to become famous/to become notorious
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
known throughout the country (idiom); world-famous

sentences.english: Germans became quickly known for their fetish movies.
sentences.chinese: 之後德國的戀物癖電影迅速揚名世界。

sentences.english: I think that Rex will go far and become famous.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲雷克斯將會揚名四海。

sentences.english: Maybe this could be something that helps get his name back out there in the basketball circles.
sentences.chinese: 或許此舉有助於他重新在這個圈子裏揚名立萬。

sentences.english: She wants to get about the world.
Beckett was the first of the absurdists to win international fame.
sentences.chinese: 貝克特是第一個揚名國際的荒誕派作家。

sentences.english: This is the opportunity for the club to really establish itself on the European stage.
sentences.chinese: 這也是我們在歐洲舞臺上揚名立萬的機會。

sentences.english: They can come out and demand a salary of $60, 000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他們能揚名於世，並可要求6萬美元的年薪。

sentences.english: But I'm confident that he has what it takes to make it here.
sentences.chinese: 但我相信他能在這裏揚名立萬。

sentences.english: One is to make a name for oneself and the other is to keep it.
sentences.chinese: 世界上有兩件事情很不一樣，揚名立萬和保持聲譽。

sentences.english: The winners were not only given handsome awards but gained high fame.
sentences.chinese: 比賽的勝出者不僅能得到豐厚的獎勵還能揚名四海。

definition: reputation/declaration
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to develop/to make full use of
family history (as a literary genre)
handed down in a family/family traditions
to eulogize/to pass on praise
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
model/example/paragon
to impart/to pass on/to teach
person of outstanding talent
to create/to come up with (an idea etc)
air/manner/model/paragon/demeanor
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
